description: 共同科英文（二）課程為一學期兩學分課程，係為非英語系學生所開設的課程。目標在幫助大一學生活用中學時期所累積的英語知識，提昇英語聽、說、讀、寫整體的溝通能力。為達此目標，本課程要求教師盡量用英語上課，努力營造一個豐富的英語環境，讓學生不但有充分機會以英語參與課堂活動，且樂於使用英語與同學及老師溝通。
goals: 1. 增進學生英語溝通表達能力 2. 透過參與課程活動促進團隊精神 3. 透過多面向英語閱讀促使學生了解多元文化，拓展學生國際化視野 4. 透過課堂討論培養批判精神 5. 提升學生英語學習動機及自主學習興趣

**English II for Non-English Majors**

Spring 2020

INSTRUCTOR  Ann Wan-Hsin Lee 李婉歆, ptm104\_8774@ntnu.edu.tw

COURSE DESCRIPTION

This course aims to develop students' English proficiency regarding all four language skills. Students are expected to increase their reading and writing literacy along with listening comprehension and communication competence through a variety of in-class and out-of-class activities. Students are also expected to know about Quality Talk (深度討論) through our class/group discussion in order to learn how to think independently and critically.

English Song Presentation (50% English, 50% Chinese)

*   Presenters (3-4 people in one group)

Before your presentation, you have to …

1.  design an activity, with a handout (lyrics and the activity on one page)
2.  prepare 3 questions for a quiz in class,
3.  discuss with the teacher TWO week before your presentation, and
4.  turn in your handout ONE week before your presentation

During the presentation, **NO cellphones allowed.**

*   group member has to (1) be on stage, (2) present/explain the song, and (3) answer your classmates’ questions.

*   Extra points will be given to students who ask questions.
*   Students are expected to give feedback on the presentation every week.

Dubbing (English Only)

*   Presenters (3-4 people in a group)

Before your performance, you have to…

1.  find an English clip (4-5 minutes)
2.  watch the clip, listen and repeat what is said in the video

During the presentation, **_each_** group member has to (1) be on stage, (2) play the video with the sound off, and (3) take turns to dub your voice into the video.

*   Students are expected to give feedback on the performance every week.

Email-writing & learning portfolio (eNGLISH oNLY)

*   You will need to complete a portfolio to show the efforts you’ve made throughout the semester.
*   You are required to write a formal English email and send your portfolio to the instructor.

FINAL EXAM

*   You will need to present a comic strip for your oral exam on June 19
*   **NO cellphones allowed.**
*   You can bring a hand-written note.
*   Bonus points will be given to students who keep their drafts in their portfolio.
